properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A frontal system will approach the Central Coast - Inland Sections this evening and stall over the region through Friday night. This system combined with the cold airmass in the area will bring snow heavy at times. A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 25 to 35 cm can be expected from tonight through Friday night. Snow will taper off Saturday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-06T15:41:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-05T23:42:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0493747634.2019
Area: Central Coast - inland sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Long-lasting blizzard conditions, with near zero visibility in snow and blowing snow, are expected to develop later this afternoon. Although the visibility may briefly improve at times, the hazardous conditions are forecast to continue into Friday. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-06T07:23:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-05T15:24:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2989740162.2019
Area: Tuktoyaktuk - East Channel Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: High Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Roseau River From Gardenton To Dominion City
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Roseau River from Gardenton to Dominion City due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-12-06T13:15:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-12-05T13:17:47-06:00, 84EAEFEF-28CE-4853-98D0-75D27937D753
Area: Roseau River from Gardenton to Dominion City
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of about 20 cm is expected. A low pressure centre over the Gulf of Alaska will bring heavy snow to the South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass. The snow will begin near noon and ease to flurries this evening. The highest snowfall amounts are expected near White Pass where up to 20 cm of snow is forecast by Friday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-06T11:03:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-05T19:04:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1475771518.2019
Area: South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect overnight into Friday morning. Snow is expected to develop overnight, and will continue into Friday morning. Total snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are likely by the middle of the day. The morning commute will be impacted due to low visibility in heavy snow at times and accumulating snow on untreated surfaces. Conditions are expected to improve Friday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-06T19:42:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-06T03:43:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3890914993.2019
Area: City of Toronto, Uxbridge - Beaverton - Northern Durham Region, Newmarket - Georgina - Northern York Region, Pickering - Oshawa - Southern Durham Region, Vaughan - Richmond Hill - Markham, Belleville - Quinte West - Eastern Northumberland County, Cobourg - Colborne - Western Northumberland County, Kingston - Odessa - Frontenac Islands, Napanee - Consecon, Picton - Sandbanks Park, Lindsay - Southern Kawartha Lakes, Peterborough City - Lakefield - Southern Peterborough County, Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County, Guelph - Erin - Southern Wellington County, Kitchener - Cambridge - Region of Waterloo, Innisfil - New Tecumseth - Angus, Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County, Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County, Caledon, Mississauga - Brampton, Halton Hills - Milton, Burlington - Oakville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has issued an Air Quality Advisory for Vanderhoof because of high concentrations of fine particulate matter. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. If you are experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, follow the advice of your health care provider. Staying indoors and in air conditioned spaces helps to reduce fine particulate exposure. Exposure is particularly a concern for pregnant women, infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-12-06T16:48:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2019-12-06T00:49:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2663455393.2019
Area: B.C. North Peace River, Stuart - Nechako
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A frontal system moving across the Interior will give snow to parts of the Central Interior and Columbias. Snow from the system will start this evening and become heavier overnight. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 cm can be expected before the snow tapers off to a few flurries near midday Friday. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-06T15:39:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-05T23:40:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1806144309.2019
Area: Highway 97 - Clinton to 100 Mile House via Begbie Summit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Snow at times heavy will begin this evening as a frontal system moves into the Columbia region. Heavy snow will continue into Friday morning with up to 25 cm possible by Friday afternoon. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-06T12:30:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-05T20:31:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2166828671.2019
Area: Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Localized fog is expected to become more widespread tonight and last into Friday afternoon. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-06T14:22:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-05T22:23:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0893925009.2019
